top_comments.comment: Want THREE (3) Masters booster boxes (2015, 2017, and Ultimate)? It's the Triple Masters giveaway! Just donate in multiples of $4.00 to Trans Lifeline below and I will send one donor ALL THREE boxes on Oct 30 at 6pm PST! I'll mail worldwide! But there's also 45 additional MTG prizes going out to 45 additional donors! You can see the full list here: https://twitter.com/TolarianCollege/status/1454226004130426884?s=20 and you just need to donate in $4 multiples. Each $4 is another chance to get a cool prize! comments_since_last_sample.body: But wait, isn’t casting a spell just kicker?  Instead of not paying mana, you just pay mana to do something in the game!
I would love to know how to explain banding as either kicker or horsemanship.

im now scouring my brain trying to think of a mechanic that couldnt be word salad'ed into kicker and I think I have one. 

Radiance - Rav city of guilds. If you posit that there is some additional cost for additional effect = kicker, 
Then, Radiance has no extra cost. It will radiate even if there is nothing to radiate too, or if there is a million radiate targets. paying anymore or any less for the other creatures does not alter the effect of the spells with radiate.

I think Dredge may fit in this as well as the act of dredging a card is completely seperate from the resolution or casting of the spell, unlike Buyback or flashback. ALthough it is kinda close to flashback. Hrm.
Deathtouch is a kicker the bucket
No no, he's got a point.
I clicked this knowing there was a chance I'd give myself something to be mad about later. "Is it all kicker?....... Fuck."
Now that's bs. Everything is just kicker OR split cards.
It me I'm the exploit/extort idiot lol but what about banding? XD
All mechanics are actually split cards.
Now this is a kicker in the gut
This is like the "every pokemon move is just dig" argument
